text: The 4 × 50 metre freestyle relay event at the 1922 Women's Olympiad was held on 22 April 1922. The venue of the competition was the Port Hercules, the harbour of Monte Carlo, Monaco. The Swedish team won ahead of the Netherlands and Great Britain. ==Results== Sweden, Netherlands, Belgium, France and Great Britain entered for the competition. The first Dutch swimmer Alide Bolten was leading the race. At the time the second and third Dutch women, Annie Treffers and Truus Klapwijk, where swimming the Swedish women were closing the gap. The third Swedish womam Carin Nilsson closed the gap and was leading the race. The fourth Swedish woman, national champion Aina Berg, expanded the gap and won the race in a time of 2:25. The Netherlands finished four seconds later and Great Britain finished third. Rank Nation Swimmers Time Notes Margit Bratt Hjördis Töpel Carin Nilsson Aina Berg 2:25.6 Alida Bolten Annie Treffers Truus Klapwijk Rie Beisenherz 2:29 or 2:34.6 4 Andrée Bonnet Ernestine Lebrun Marcelle Lebrun Mariette Protin 5 Sources: ==References== Category:1922 Women's Olympiad Category:Women's swimming
title: Swimming at the 1922 Women's Olympiad – 4 × 50 metre freestyle relay
